name: Shoyu Ramen
description: A soy sauce-based ramen with a savory, umami-rich broth, often paired with curly noodles and toppings like chashu pork and bamboo shoots

name: Miso Ramen
description: A fermented miso paste broth with a slightly sweet, earthy taste, commonly served with corn, bean sprouts, and butter

name: Shio Ramen
description: A light, salt-seasoned broth that highlights delicate flavors, often enjoyed with seafood or chicken and thin, straight noodles

name: Tonkotsu Ramen
description: A rich, creamy pork bone broth with a thick, collagen-heavy texture, typically served with thin noodles, tender chashu, and garlic oil

name: Spicy Shoyu Ramen
description: A fiery twist on classic shoyu ramen, blending soy sauce broth with chili paste or oil for a bold, spicy kick

name: Spicy Miso Ramen
description: Miso broth intensified with spicy seasonings like chili oil or ground pork, offering a deep, warming heat

name: Tantanmen Ramen
description: Sichuan dan dan noodles, featuring a spicy, nutty sesame-peanut broth with ground pork and chili oil

name: Spicy Sesame Ramen
description: A nutty, aromatic broth infused with toasted sesame and chili, delivering a rich and slightly smoky heat

name: Spicy Chicken Ramen
description: A lighter but still fiery option with a chicken-based broth, often topped with shredded chicken and fresh greens

name: Spicy Pork Ramen
description: A robust, meaty ramen with a pork-based broth enhanced with chili spices, often featuring minced or sliced pork

name: Mochi Ice Cream
description: Sweet, chewy mochi (glutinous rice dough) wrapped around creamy ice cream in flavors like matcha, strawberry, or vanilla

name: Coffee Jelly
description: Made of coffee-flavored gelatin, often served with whipped cream or condensed milk for a bittersweet treat
